definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither

sentences.english: I still cannot forget the cold winter, when you took me to the keyboard class.
sentences.chinese: 至今我也不法忘记你带我学电子琴的那个寒冷的冬天。

sentences.english: There are my keyboard on the desk, and I often read the book.
sentences.chinese: 写字台上放着我的电子琴，还有我平时常看的书。

sentences.english: He is the keyboard player in this electronic band.
sentences.chinese: 他是这个电声乐队的电子琴手。

sentences.english: We study English and electronic organ.
sentences.chinese: 我们学习英语和电子琴。

sentences.english: I dislike playing once Electronic organ , but now I have changed my way of thinking.
sentences.chinese: 我曾经不喜欢弹奏电子琴，但现在我改变了这个想法。

sentences.english: I like electronic organ as well as English.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢电子琴，也同样喜欢英语。

sentences.english: Electronic organs are much smaller and cheaper than pipe organs.
sentences.chinese: 电子琴要比管风琴小得多，也便宜得多。

sentences.english: My hobby is music and electronic organ.
sentences.chinese: 我的爱好是音乐和电子琴。

sentences.english: A: Do you play the keyboard?
I like electronic organ, also liking English equally.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢电子琴，也同样喜欢英语。

definition: zither or guzheng/large zither with 13 to 25 strings, developed from guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] during Tang and Song times
